paragraph.paragraph: Explicit cluster folders (../../../../../images/icons/cluster.ico) are clusters that have been explicitly added to the project. cluster_folders.xmlCluster folders or implicit cluster folders (../../../../../images/icons/cluster_folder.ico) are those cluster folders that have been added as a result of cluster recursion, set by the include_subdirectories../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlInclude Subdirectories property of a explicit cluster folder.

An cluster is a logical grouping of Eiffel source files (*.e) based on a root location. Every clusters has a path../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlPath, which is it's root location. Based on this path EiffelEnvision projects will cluster_enumeration.xmlautomatically include any located Eiffel source files and, if include_subdirectories../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlincluding subdirectories, will include sub directories and their contained Eiffel source files.

The cluster mechanism is employed by the Eiffel for .NET compiler to facilitate the development of large projects (That is not to say it is harder to configure smaller project. EiffelEnvision projects are completely scalable. It's just as simple to manage and configure small project as it is larger projects.) The mechanism uses directories instead of referencing individual files, and permits finer grained compilation configuration through the ../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder Properties, which directly affect how the Eiffel for .NET compiler compiles the Eiffel source files contained with the cluster.

When an explicit cluster folder's cluster_library../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlCluster Library is set to Yes explicit cluster folders are shown using the ../../../../../images/icons/cluster_library.ico. In addition a number of the cluster_library../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder Properties are disabled. The properties are disabled because the Eiffel for .NET compiler will ignore all subsequent changes the explicit cluster folder's configuration once it has been compiled into a project. After all libraries clusters are libraries and are not expected to be modified regularly.

Marking explicit cluster folders as libraries gives a significant performance gain when ../../../../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlCompiling Projects because all configuration and file changes are ignored by the compiler and EiffelEnvision.

EiffelEnvision makes it easy to share projects with other developers by permitting the use of ../../../configuring/environment_variables.xmlEnvironment Variables. If you are not using ../../../configuring/environment_variables.xmlEnvironment Variables or simply that other developers to not have the same variable defined, clusters may be seen to be missing. Missing clusters are shown with the ../../../../../images/icons/cluster_missing.ico icon or ../../../../../images/icons/cluster_library_missing.ico depending on the explicit cluster folder's library_statusexplicit_clusters.xmlLibrary Status. To resolve the missing cluster amend the path../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlPath property.

Explicit cluster folders allow new and existing items/file_items.xmlfile and items/file_items.xmlEiffel class file items to be added directly underneath them. New cluster_folders.xmlfolders can also be added and other files and Eiffel class files items added to them. In addition Explicit cluster folder can also have child explicit cluster folders added to them to create a cluster hierarchy intermixed with a file system hierarchy that was cluster_enumeration.xmlautomatically enumerated based on the cluster's path../../../configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/clusters.xmlPath. For more information on adding new cluster, see ../../../configuring/adding_items/adding_clusters.xmlAdding New Clusters and cluster_context_menu.xmlExplicit Cluster Context Menu. Note: For all explicit cluster folders under the ../../eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xmlEiffel Libraries Folder only Eiffel source files can been added underneath them. Attempting to add other types of file items will results in an error dialog. Folders and other explicit clusters folder can be added.
Explicit cluster folders have their own context menu. See cluster_context_menu.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder Context Menu for a detailed rundown of the items that are available.
